example.name: most common usage
example.text: He figures P&G will expand its personal-care product line in Japan to ``continue that momentum.''
example.arg: P&G will expand its personal-care product line in Japan to ``continue that momentum

example.name: plan an infinite-S
example.text: Pierre Peladeau, a Canadian newspaper publisher little-known in the U.S., figures to become a big player in North American printing -- and his ambitions don't end there.
example.arg: Pierre Peladeau , a Canadian newspaper publisher little-known in the U.S. ,
to become a big player in North American printing

role.descr: role or event, act, what arg0 figures into

example.name: not exactly a role
example.text: The Chicago office figured prominently in the bank's problems earlier this year, when $65 million in loans to Chicago businessman William Stoecker went sour.
example.arg: in the bank's problems earlier this year, when $65 million in loans to Chicago businessman William Stoecker went sour

example.name: passive
example.text: This had been the exclusive province of those rich enough to use six-figure sums to get income that-1 [*trace*-1]-2 was figured *trace*-2 beyond the third or fourth decimal place.
example.arg: beyond the third or fourth decimal place

predicate.note: Frames file for 'figure' based on sentences in financial subcorpus.

roleset.name: to be expected (it figures)
roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls

example.name: Empty it
example.text: And it figures that rain would pelt down as I am about to leave the house, wouldn't it?
example.arg: that rain would pelt down as I am about to leave the house, wouldn't it

example.name: you figure it out
example.text: James Cleveland, a courier who-1 [*trace*-1]-2 earned a Bravo Zulu for *trace*-2 figuring out how to get a major customer's 1,100-parcel-a-week load to its doorstep by 8 a.m., considers himself far more than a courier.
example.arg: how to get a major customer's 1,100-parcel-a-week load to its doorstep by 8 a.m.
